meanings.definition: To go around or along the edge of something
meanings.sent1: The cat was skirting around the puddle to avoid getting wet.
meanings.sent2: She enjoys skirting the park during her morning walks.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel was skirting the tree trunk in a playful game of chase.
meanings.sent4: The detective was skirting the crime scene, searching for clues.
meanings.sent5: The river was skirting the town, providing a scenic view for the residents.

meanings.definition: A border or edging around a room or piece of furniture
meanings.sent1: The room looked elegant with its white skirting along the walls.
meanings.sent2: She painted the skirting of the table in a vibrant shade of blue.
meanings.sent3: The skirting of the bedsheet added a touch of sophistication to the room.
meanings.sent4: The skirting of the carpet matched perfectly with the curtains.
meanings.sent5: The skirting of the shelf prevented items from falling off.
